 keeping you

No, that=
 is all fine and I agree. I am questioning the RESTfulness of  
specs that =
allow the clients to make assumptions about the hypermedia  
it will receiv=
e at some point in the interaction. AtomPub for example  
enables the clien=
t *implementor* to assume that a GET on a collection  
will return an Atom =
feed document. This is equivalent to making an  
assumption about the appli=
cation state to be in after the GET to the  
collection.

And I am trying t=
o say that M2M clients (besides passibe, server  
driven crawlers) can only=
 be built when such contracts are in place.
